Using an Alternate Working Folder for a View

The default working folder established for a view may not be the optimal choice for all users. You, or any other user with appropriate access rights, can select a more convenient location for this folder on a workstation by designating an alternate working folder. The alternate working folder path for the view is specific to the workstation and user. You will not be able to access it from a different workstation, even if you log in with the same user name.

When you designate an alternate working folder for the view, the path to the working folder for each child folder will be similarly modified on your workstation, unless the child folder has an absolute path or a working folder of its own. Your alternate working folder becomes part of the path for every folder in the hierarchy that has a relative path to the view.

To use an alternate working folder for a view:

  1. Select View > Properties from the menu. The View Properties dialog opens.

  2. Select the Info tab.

  3. In the Working Folder group box, select the Alternate option button.

  4. Enter or browse for an alternate working folder.

  5. Click OK.

Important: An alternate working folder must point to a location that is physically discrete for each user, such as a directory on the user's hard drive or a personal directory on a shared file server.
